flawed_nl_solution:
By the first two months, 1/5*200 = <<1/5*200=40>>40 mountains had erupted.
The total number of mountains remaining after the first round of explosions is 200-40= <<200-40=106>>106
When 2/5 of the remaining mountains exploded, the number of mountains that were still intact decreased by 2/5*106 = <<2/5*106=212/5>>212/5
The number of mountains that hadn't exploded after the second explosions is 106-212/5 = <<106-212/5=318/5>>318/5
When 1/2 of the mountains which were still intact exploded, the number of mountains that hadn't erupted was reduced by 1/2*318/5 = <<1/2*318/5=159/5>>159/5
At the end of the year, 318/5-159/5 = <<318/5-159/5=159/5>>159/5 mountains remained intact and hadn't exploded.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 160, not 106. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
